channel.title: Mohammad Sabik Irbaz
channel.description: Recent content on Mohammad Sabik Irbaz

item.title: Bio
item.description: Assalamu Alaikum (May peace be upon you), I am Mohammad Sabik Irbaz, born and raised in Bangladesh, near the longest sea-beach in the world, Cox’s Bazar. You can call me Sabik. I am an independent Machine Learning (ML) researcher mainly focused on Natural Language Processing (NLP). Currently, I am working as the head course instructor of Applied Data Science and Machine Learning at Amar iSchool, an online educational platform where we empower the ML enthusiasts with a limited background knowledge of Computer Science and Mathematics.

item.title: Contacts

item.title: Experience
item.description: Industry Experience Pioneer Alpha Ltd. , Dhaka, Bangladesh Lead Machine Learning Engineer, Full Time January, 2021 - September, 2021 Omdena Inc. , New York, USA Lead Machine Learning Engineer, Part Time April, 2021 - June, 2021 Nascenia Ltd. , Dhaka, Bangladesh Software Engineer, Intern November, 2019 - January 2020 Research Experience Fordham Human Centered AI Reseach Lab Department of CIS, Fordham University New York, USA March, 2021 - Present System and Software Lab (SSL) Department of CSE, IUT Dhaka, Bangladesh July, 2019 - Present Teaching Experience Amar iSchool Head Course Instructor, Part Time Applied Data Science and Machine Learning March, 2021 - Present

item.title: News
item.description: Starting from September 2021 2021 24-Sep   Presented our paper on Real Time Face Recognition in BIM 2021 . 14-Sep   Our paper on Bangla Conversational Agent got accepted in IEEE ICMLA 2021 .

item.title: Projects
item.description: Please read this before going through the projects. I could not link the source code to some of the projects below due to client confidentiality or lab confidentiality. Everything related to a particular project is not described to the full extent here. I only discussed the motivation (why and how I or my team started working on this problem), problem statement (what the problem is/was in short), approach (not the formal version, just how I or my team approached the problem), results (final outcome) and my contribution (what exactly I did and learned new from this project).
